byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting from Albany.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, in an Op-Ed article published by The New York Times, said he would ask the state labor commissioner to convene a panel to consider if the pay for thousands should go up.

headline.print_headline: Cuomo Seeks Higher Pay for Fast-Food Workers, Citing Industry’s Income Gap
headline.main: Cuomo Moves to Raise Wages for New York Fast-Food Workers

snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, in an Op-Ed article published by The New York Times, said he would ask the state labor commissioner to convene a panel to consider if the pay for thousands should go up.
abstract: New York State Gov Andrew M Cuomo will ask state labor commissioner to convene panel to consider minimum wage raise for state's fast-food workers; move follows failure of his bid to raise statewide minimum wage to $10.50.
